author: Special Correspondent
text:
Press Information Bureau, Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, is organising a three-day public information campaign here to disseminate information about the programmes of the Central and State governments from Thursday.

The campaign would mainly focus on Indradhanush, vaccine immunisation programme; Digital India and Skill India; and Women Empowerment and Entrepreneurship.

Experts would participate in various seminars to be organised on the chosen themes on three days at the Madurai Medical College.

Briefing about the campaign, the Collector, K. Veeraraghava Rao, said that the inaugural day campaign would be on implementation of Indradhanush in Madurai district.

The mission aims to ensure that all children under the age of two and all pregnant women are fully immunised against seven diseases including Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus, Tuberculosis, Polio, Hepatitis B and Measles. The second day programme would be on Digital India and Skill India that is aimed at increasing the efficiency of the government and public sector using digital tools and additional skills, the Collector said.

The third and final day campaign has been dedicated for women empowerment and entrepreneurship in which various schemes formulated by the Central and State Governments to help women live with dignity would be explained.
title: Three-day public information campaign to begin today
